data.event: Keith Baskerville -- the only survivor in the Sept. 13 event -- is charged with felony murder, abduction and carjacking charges in the death of 60-year-old Barbara Bosworth.

event.title: This month, a judge in Prince William County Circuit Court declared

data.event: This month, a judge in Prince William County Circuit Court declared Baskerville incompetent to stand trial and ordered him sent to Western State Hospital for treatment.
Baskerville appeared in court Friday, when a judge was scheduled to review his case.

event.title: April 24, when a judge will review

data.event: Baskerville is now due back in court April 24, when a judge will review his competency.

event.title: abducted Bosworth from Springfield Mall in September

data.event: Police said Baskerville and another man, 19-year-old Lutchman Chandler, abducted Bosworth from Springfield Mall in September and drove her to a PDQ Mart in Woodbridge, where they tried to use her ATM card to withdraw money.

event.title: had not been sent there before his court appearance Friday

data.event: He had not been sent there before his court appearance Friday because of a lack of bed space at the hospital, O'Brien said.
